comment: Super easy class over the summer, that being said didn't like the teacher. Barely answered emails or answered them late. The class was set up was strange and he didn't explain things well.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: A nice guy and the class is just ridiculously easy, just make sure to show up, easy online tests, no lockdown, easy Pearson assignments and a few in class worksheets. Only things, he screws up grades a lot and is hard to contact, he lost my entire assignment, could have lost my A, he mumbles with no mic and an accent too so u will not learn much.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He a decent professor. He cancels class frequently and takes forever to respond to emails. He says use the textbook, but honestly, I haven't even opened it all semester and got an A. Attendance isn't mandatory but will send out announcements saying there is a quiz today, but he goes over the answers in class. Very easy, but just annoying.
rating_tags: Participation matters

comment: Professor Ezewudo is sometimes difficult to understand and isn't always super clear on what assignments will consist of. He will respond to emails within a few days, but is strict on deadlines. The class involves online MMES assignments every few weeks and a simple "quiz" or short activity each week based on the virtual lab assignments.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class

comment: There were 120 people in this class that was held in an auditorium and he didn't think it would be a clever idea to use a microphone. I sat in the fourth row and still couldn't hear him; he also has a thick accent so I could only get a few words out from anything he said. I stopped going to class, but attendance wasn't required. Class was easy.
rating_tags: Graded by few things

comment: Professor Ezewudo is straightforward with how he structures his class. The quizzes are based on an easy weekly lab, and the tests are online and pretty easy if you follow his power points. Attendance isn't mandatory for lectures, but sometimes he gives out extra credit if you attend class to take place of any assignments you may have missed.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: I never went to one of his lectures but all his work was online and very easy even our tests. The only thing was the unnecessary 1k work essay at the end of the semester (it ended up being really easy) and the fact he doesn't respond to emails. If you need this classes credits, its not terrible to take this teacher.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: I would not recommend this class, or at least with this professor. He is contradictory and becomes upset if you do not attend class (even with it not being mandatory in the syllabus) and lashes out but forcing in-person quizzes/assignments.  He does not use a mic in lectures, and becomes agitated if you mention not hearing his voice well. DNR!!

If you want a class that you barely do anything and can still get an easy A or B, then I would recommend this class. We would only have 1 assignment a week. Sometimes, we wouldn't even have an assignment that week. So, I would recommend taking if you have a heavy class load or just want an easy class.

You only do MES activities, a few quizzes, open note tests, and he posts notes. He doesn't teach and you do the learning yourself, which is fine and easy imo. However, the real problem is he only sometimes promptly emails you back, and assumes the worst of his students as being grade grubbers all the time. Make sure to address him as Dr.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Dr EzEwUdO is one of the worst professors I have had so far, he doesn't respond to emails, he doesn't work with you. Also, if you call him anything other than "doctor" he will get butt hurt. His quizzes are awful he never taught us anything just expected us to do his job for him and then take the tests.

Very easy class, one assignment every two weeks. Easiest tests in college cause the answers are right off his lecture slides. Open book/notes test. Would highly recommend taking his science class with him.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Caring

comment: Extremely easy, bare-minimum course but an overwhelmingly rude professor. Didnt accommodate to students with important needs outside of school or disabilities and his responses were consistently rude. Wouldnt take another course by him just because of how he treats students.
rating_tags: Graded by few things

comment: I would not take him he barely taught.

You wont learn anything in this class- which I was fine with I needed to get it over with. You do one small assignment like once a month and you have a few tests. Very easy to balance with a busy schedule bc you never do anything for the class. Professor also is rude and never answer emails but take it if you dont care any communication
rating_tags: Graded by few things

comment: This guy basically handed out A's. You end up having to do a few silly assignments, but the tests are easy. He also consistently ended class 30 minutes early. Really easy especially considering if you're taking this class, it isn't your major.

Final is not comprehensive and tests are similar to study guide. Without studying most people get an A every exam. There are writing assignments and he is a tough grader and will not tell you why you got the grade you did. Despite that you can still get an A easily. Very long group essay project. He also does random participation quizzes in class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: it's easy to do well in this class, but he really pisses me off. he makes attendance non-mandatory but gets butthurt if no one shows up and assigns random quizzes/assignments during class that arent listed in syllabus. difficult to understand and vague with instructions/feedback. he's alright, just frustrating. I wouldnt take him again

Long lectures. He has a heavy accent so it is very hard to understand him unless you sit close. The class was easy, all homework was on quizlet and tests were the exact same as study guides. One group project at the end that's with 6 people and it is an 8 page paper. Group quizzes, one quiz on your own, and 3 tests.
rating_tags: Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Ezewudo was honestly great! He does have an accent, but it's not impossible to understand him. The study guides and exams are identical and all multiple choice. You should go to class daily, because he tends to do pop assignments or have you turn things in for attendance and participation credit. All-in-all great class! Easy A to say the least.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Kind of hard to understand, but pretty simple class. He's clearly knowledgeable and over-qualified for a low-level course. Complete your assignments and you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: Dont listen to the reviews saying this class was hard. This class is very easy, his first test is word for word from the study guide he gives . The other 2 are almost the exact same also . Just read the power points and do the study guides and you WILL GET AN A ! In addition , hes a great guy. Heavy accent. I suggest sit upfront .
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Easy content. He cancelled class often. One group project with 16 people. Did an extra credit power point and still got a C. How? He loses papers (he doesnt like d2l submissions), he forgets what he assigned & doesnt keep proper records of grades. I couldnt prove I was missing 2 papers because they were handwritten. Take pics before turning in.

very strong accent thats really hard to understand. really easy class but he gives a lot of busy work assignments. doesn't take attendance but if a lot of people begin to skip he'll start giving in-class assignments and quizzes

Unless you want to be treated like a science major looking to be an environmental scientist for the rest of your life and not somebody who's just trying to get through a gen ed class do not take this guy. On the first day of his class my gut was telling me to drop his class and take a different instructor, I should have listened to my gut.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: At first I hesitated to take his class because of some of these reviews but he is a good teacher. We do have writing assignments but he requires them to be a page long. We have three test and one of them is a group project. Also MES assignments that he gives a lot of time to get done. His accent is not hard to understand either. Easy A.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Strong accent. It can be difficult to understand him especially if you sit in the back of his class. However, tests are easy if you use the study guide he gives out. Biggest thing I can say is that he is sensitive. If people start not showing up to his class he gets offended and will start making pop quizzes and in-class assignments very common.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Hard to understand has a accent!
rating_tags: GROUP PROJECTS--Inspirational--Hilarious

comment: you do have labs but if you take it in the summer, its like 6 & are done outside of class. His class was 2hrs45min long but stayed for 1hr Hes very sarcastic and has an accent but he understands that so he gives u studyguides that are exactly like the test. the study is just a little longer. He doesnt give the answers though you have to find it
rating_tags: Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: Dr. Ezewudo was an excellent professor. Everything we had to do was easy and self-explanatory. There would be times that he would cancel class for an entire week so that we could focus on a certain project or our online homework. He does have an accent, but it isn't super difficult to understand him. Try to attend class everyday, random assignments
rating_tags: Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Ehh it depends I went for attendance but lectures were useless. He has an accent I understood him fine but some complained hard. He also gives a group project at the end of the yr so be ready to work with at least 21 of 150 plus people for a heavy grade. There are outside assignments along with quizzes based on the labs not based on lectures.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Very frustrating professor. He claims attendance is not mandatory and there will only be one quiz a week. By about the third week he was having graded assignments every single class with about twice the amount of quizzes we were told we would have. He accepts no excuses for missing class, yet he once cancelled three classes in a row, one for rain.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: people say his accent its bad, but they were probably the ones lucky enough to get a seat in the front. his whole class is made up of people saying what did he say? i cant understand him! and then he cant really understand us sometimes! he is a nice guy ... i think but i need a prof that i can understand... how else can i learn?

This class is probably one of the easiest environmental science class. The homework is easy and you have to do group projects that are essays with about 30 people only twice, but it can be done. The test are easy if you study the study guides. Honestly I would take him again and for sci 1102.
rating_tags: Respected--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: He has a heavy accent making it difficult to understand, but he is such an easy professor. Tests are the exact same as the review and he will cancel class a lot.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I got the feeling Dr. Ezewudo was new at teaching. The class was kind of disorganized, but that only made it easier to pass. The final group project was really easy to do because each group had at least 20 people. The lectures were a total waste. Sometimes he had in class assignments, and sometimes he didn't. You can skip a lot and pass.
It's a super easy class, if you show up you should pass. He does have a very thick accent though, he's from Nigeria. If you have a hard time with foreign accents at all, do not take him.
rating_tags: Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GROUP PROJECTS
